commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I12fe30e11c7462b6cada89b12946c0cd6fae1607

subject: Fix assisted volume snapshots race condition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-20 14:01:16.000000000', 'files': ['compute_hyperv/nova/volumeops.py'], 'message': "Fix assisted volume snapshots race condition

While performing assisted volume snapshots, we're setting the
instance task state to 'image_snapshot_pending' in order to prevent
instance actions that would impact this operation.

The issue is that we're clearing the task state only after calling
back the Cinder API, telling it that the snapshot was created or
deleted. For this reason, a subsequent assisted snapshot request
will be rejected by the Nova API if the task state is not cleared
in time.

This race condition affects quite a few tempest tests that cover
this scenario.

This change ensures that the instance task state is cleared before
calling back the Cinder API.

Closes-Bug: #1739423

Change-Id: I1ae57c109ed551ba03d49b2ac7c6318b3939526d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix assisted volume snapshots race condition

While performing assisted volume snapshots, we're setting the
instance task state to 'image_snapshot_pending' in order to prevent
instance actions that would impact this operation.

The issue is that we're clearing the task state only after calling
back the Cinder API, telling it that the snapshot was created or
deleted. For this reason, a subsequent assisted snapshot request
will be rejected by the Nova API if the task state is not cleared
in time.

This race condition affects quite a few tempest tests that cover
this scenario.

This change ensures that the instance task state is cleared before
calling back the Cinder API.

Closes-Bug: #1739423

Change-Id: I1ae57c109ed551ba03d49b2ac7c6318b3939526d

subject: storage: fix upgrade when password contains a %
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-20 11:06:12.000000000', 'files': ['aodh/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': "storage: fix upgrade when password contains a %

oslo.config doesn't support %{} or %() variable interpolation while
ConfigParser does.

So when a password contains a '%', it's fine for oslo.config
But the Python ConfigParser will raise the exception.

Since alembic use ConfigParser and not oslo.config, we have to escape
the url ourself.

This is not a big deal since, we don't want alembic doing variable
interpolation.

Change-Id: If7bfe7f082f4352fb49992a2216f2dd5b8993711
(cherry picked from commit 268c1e8e9e519b57f9b8c271f806efba0d4651e1)
"}]
commit_message:
storage: fix upgrade when password contains a %

oslo.config doesn't support %{} or %() variable interpolation while
ConfigParser does.

So when a password contains a '%', it's fine for oslo.config
But the Python ConfigParser will raise the exception.

Since alembic use ConfigParser and not oslo.config, we have to escape
the url ourself.

This is not a big deal since, we don't want alembic doing variable
interpolation.

Change-Id: If7bfe7f082f4352fb49992a2216f2dd5b8993711
(cherry picked from commit 268c1e8e9e519b57f9b8c271f806efba0d4651e1)

commit_message:
storage: fix upgrade when password contains a %

oslo.config doesn't support %{} or %() variable interpolation while
ConfigParser does.

So when a password contains a '%', it's fine for oslo.config
But the Python ConfigParser will raise the exception.

Since alembic use ConfigParser and not oslo.config, we have to escape
the url ourself.

This is not a big deal since, we don't want alembic doing variable
interpolation.

Change-Id: If7bfe7f082f4352fb49992a2216f2dd5b8993711
(cherry picked from commit 268c1e8e9e519b57f9b8c271f806efba0d4651e1)

commit_message:
Add user-delete to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the user-delete command.

The trove command user-delete is now:
    openstack database user delete

Change-Id: Ie11a2a41dfca0e1f58e155eaf7c5949e11352c6a
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Load undercloud DB password to a mistral environment

This patch adds a new variable to the mistral
environment 'tripleo.undercloud-config' allowing
to retrieve the root password for the MySQL
databases. Now this variable can be accessed from any
Mistral workflow.
Also, this patch adds the ability of checking if
the variables are not loaded properly due to
an upgrade, in that case we update the Mistral
environment to have all the variables in place.

Change-Id: I822c3d96b5805909656d8e92e963b851f3bd77de

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-07 18:51:13.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic', 'devstack/tools/ironic/templates/vm.xml', 'zuul.d/project.yaml', 'devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/configure-vm.py', 'devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/create-node.sh'], 'message': "Testing

[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

Devstack currently plugs the simulated baremetal VMs into OVS using the
libvirt bridge driver, this caused a problem because libvirt unplugs the
VM from the network when it is turned off. To fix this an extra bridge
was added between the VM and OVS to allow the OVS port to persist even
when the VM was turned off. This patch replaces how the devstack
simulated baremetal VMs are plugged into OVS with a manually created tap
interface, this removes the need for an extra bridge, because manually
created tap interfaces aren't unplugged when the VM is turned off.

Allow to connect several interfaces to a node by setting
IRONIC_VM_INTERFACE_COUNT devstack variable.

Change-Id: I7d0249efc55edb4f3a69aaa5b101dd80df2a563f

(cherry picked from commit 6df49741ddf8fd28f78cebca4dca55d34a07a5a1)

one job
Change-Id: I0bd8f061789e67b3515fa3949c5cb13f2da6fc52
"}]
commit_message:
Testing

[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

Devstack currently plugs the simulated baremetal VMs into OVS using the
libvirt bridge driver, this caused a problem because libvirt unplugs the
VM from the network when it is turned off. To fix this an extra bridge
was added between the VM and OVS to allow the OVS port to persist even
when the VM was turned off. This patch replaces how the devstack
simulated baremetal VMs are plugged into OVS with a manually created tap
interface, this removes the need for an extra bridge, because manually
created tap interfaces aren't unplugged when the VM is turned off.

Allow to connect several interfaces to a node by setting
IRONIC_VM_INTERFACE_COUNT devstack variable.

Change-Id: I7d0249efc55edb4f3a69aaa5b101dd80df2a563f
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6df49741ddf8fd28f78cebca4dca55d34a07a5a1)

one job
Change-Id: I0bd8f061789e67b3515fa3949c5cb13f2da6fc52

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-09-15 11:16:06.000000000', 'files': ['fluentd/templates/etc/_td-agent.conf.tpl', 'tools/images/fluentd/Dockerfile', 'fluentd/values.yaml', 'tools/images/fluentd/README.rst'], 'message': 'More elaborate fluentd filtering

This commit attempts at implementing more elaborate filtering in our
fluentd. Right now it:

* Updates fluentd version and provides Dockerfile that installs
  fluent-plugin-concat on top.
* Switches log source from /var/lib/docker/containers to
  /var/lib/containers. This enables kubernetes_metadata filter to
  actually do its work.
* Separates OpenStack services logs (tag openstack.*) and other services
  logs (tag kubernetes.*).
* Extracts log level from oslo.log messages.
* Groups multiline traceback log messages from OpenStack services into
  one log.

Change-Id: I73045af51e22d4eb80d04ce41a3de8c9e4e82332
Co-Authored-by: Mateusz Blaszkowski <mateusz.blaszkowski@intel.com>

commit_message:
More elaborate fluentd filtering

This commit attempts at implementing more elaborate filtering in our
fluentd. Right now it:

* Updates fluentd version and provides Dockerfile that installs
  fluent-plugin-concat on top.
* Switches log source from /var/lib/docker/containers to
  /var/lib/containers. This enables kubernetes_metadata filter to
  actually do its work.
* Separates OpenStack services logs (tag openstack.*) and other services
  logs (tag kubernetes.*).
* Extracts log level from oslo.log messages.
* Groups multiline traceback log messages from OpenStack services into
  one log.

Change-Id: I73045af51e22d4eb80d04ce41a3de8c9e4e82332

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-19 16:43:12.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project-templates.yaml'], 'message': "Rework translation templates

Currently we run the post job for each and every change, even if that
branch is not set up in Zanata for translation.

Since we have already branch specific templates, let's use them and add
a post job for each of them that mirrors the periodic job.

This way we only run a post job on a branch if we also have a
corresponding periodic job to import changes back.

Change-Id: I6b647ecee41f1d41f0d59f913d5213046b253b22
"}]
commit_message:
Rework translation templates

Currently we run the post job for each and every change, even if that
branch is not set up in Zanata for translation.

Since we have already branch specific templates, let's use them and add
a post job for each of them that mirrors the periodic job.

This way we only run a post job on a branch if we also have a
corresponding periodic job to import changes back.

Change-Id: I6b647ecee41f1d41f0d59f913d5213046b253b22

subject: Drop django_openstack_auth master branch jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-19 14:13:47.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Drop django_openstack_auth master branch jobs

In Queens cycle, the code of django_openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repository. The master branch of django_openstack_auth
will be retired.

This commit skips the jobs of django_openstack_auth for the master
branch. We still maintain the stable branches, so the jobs need to be kept.
Zuul project template does not support brances, so required project
templates are converted into jobs.

system-required template is kept as this is just a merge-check noop job.
publish-to-pypi is kept too as we don't release django_openstack_auth
from the master branch and there is no side effect.

Change-Id: I837c3426de1a18b4055dd7066743e427074425b3
"}]
commit_message:
Drop django_openstack_auth master branch jobs

In Queens cycle, the code of django_openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repository. The master branch of django_openstack_auth
will be retired.

This commit skips the jobs of django_openstack_auth for the master
branch. We still maintain the stable branches, so the jobs need to be kept.
Zuul project template does not support brances, so required project
templates are converted into jobs.

system-required template is kept as this is just a merge-check noop job.
publish-to-pypi is kept too as we don't release django_openstack_auth
from the master branch and there is no side effect.

Change-Id: I837c3426de1a18b4055dd7066743e427074425b3

commit_message:
Revert "Update static files"

The change of policy causes issues with heat and it is reproducible
using OSA AIO.

# sudo pip install python-heatclient
# openstack orchestration service list
ERROR: You are not authorized to use index.
# openstack stack list
ERROR: You are not authorized to use index.

This reverts commit 8fcd29197797eef409254605f0ce73ef8d1bda6b.

Change-Id: I84c56992db1a6ff8c5d71be5986aacad0099eb12

subject: Retry connection to OVSDB from metadata agent
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-19 15:50:42.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/agent/metadata/ovsdb.py'], 'message': 'Retry connection to OVSDB from metadata agent

Right now, if the connection to SB database fails from the
metadata agent, the process would just exit.
With this patch, it will retry forever, waiting 2^x seconds
between each retry, up to a max of 180 seconds.

Change-Id: If7970cd48dce5467b7dd9fa2364f39fedfbf6302
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Retry connection to OVSDB from metadata agent

Right now, if the connection to SB database fails from the
metadata agent, the process would just exit.
With this patch, it will retry forever, waiting 2^x seconds
between each retry, up to a max of 180 seconds.

Change-Id: If7970cd48dce5467b7dd9fa2364f39fedfbf6302
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Infer MACVLAN/IPVLAN ports

subject: Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-17 09:18:33.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I0919ad158b4d8cae993f5fd137d4759402d0851c
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I0919ad158b4d8cae993f5fd137d4759402d0851c

commit_message:
WIP: Manage metrics units in yaml configuration.

Allow users and operators to control the conversions units,
by filling source and destinations units for the metrics.
Differents units can now be affected to metrics from a same resource.

Task: 6077
Story: 2001396

Change-Id: I6ef2157f9351ca6f356b699e03e49428e98548db

(like mac osx). Skip these mkisofs calls by patching _make_iso9660.

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I6f9fb94e6a3bbd89d1e02bd006f7af3bf2797579

commit_message:
Adding BGPVPN OVO objects and tests

This change adds OVO objects for networking-bgpvpn, tailored
for their only consumer, networking-bagpipe.

The corresponding tests are implemented.

Testing needs a hook for BGPVPNNetAssociation, which has not been
implemented yet.

Co-Authored-By: Omar Sanhaji <sanhaji.omar@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>

Partial Implements: blueprint bagpipe-bgpvpn-ovo
Depends-On: Icb6a73aeca0286725c78a3bf403e1df895a34d4e
Change-Id: Ie0f1c9f3f2bd1cf317b921ee1c1691c2816d8832

Notification listener processes only keystone project delete events.
It uses keystone project id to identify if related barbican resources are there
and deletes that project related barbican resources.

10/07/2014: Keep resolving rebase conflicts as this change is pending for a while.
Modified listener transaction logic as per related recent change in barbican.
Fixed missing patcher stop in few places which was causing failure in new tests.

Implements: blueprint consume-keystone-events

Change-Id: Iba7d50eb222edd43352ef82f629df2b3187c76ec
'}]
commit_message:
Adding keystone notification listener support

Notification listener processes only keystone project delete events.
It uses keystone project id to identify if related barbican resources are there
and deletes that project related barbican resources.

10/07/2014: Keep resolving rebase conflicts as this change is pending for a while.
Modified listener transaction logic as per related recent change in barbican.
Fixed missing patcher stop in few places which was causing failure in new tests.

Implements: blueprint consume-keystone-events

commit_message:
Revert "Use push notification for security groups"

This reverts commit 020ea1479e3c2fac3e1ef99ed85f45792b286a0e.

The change made agents not create exchanges for old security group RPC
endpoints, which raises NotFound on server side.

Change-Id: If40678b59e539040d45a2ed1d484b9dddf20c500
Closes-Bug: #1707160

bug writing zero sized chunks and terminates correctly.

subject: Use io.open instead of open in extensions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-19 10:41:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/_exts/badges.py', 'doc/source/_exts/projects.py', 'doc/source/_exts/teams.py'], 'message': 'Use io.open instead of open in extensions

Docs fail to build due to open() not having an "encoding" kwarg
when running under Python 2.7. This switches instances using it
to use io.open instead. This is slightly slower on py2, but we are
not using it in a way that should have a noticable impact.
With py3 it is just a pass through to the normal open() call.

Change-Id: Iccad49fbfae3fe68080e65d7a8f40b7554e8df2c
'}]
commit_message:
Use io.open instead of open in extensions

Docs fail to build due to open() not having an "encoding" kwarg
when running under Python 2.7. This switches instances using it
to use io.open instead. This is slightly slower on py2, but we are
not using it in a way that should have a noticable impact.
With py3 it is just a pass through to the normal open() call.

Change-Id: Iccad49fbfae3fe68080e65d7a8f40b7554e8df2c

commit_message:
Fix status message inside validate_can_perform_action()

If we assign status with just self.db_info.task_status, we would get a
exception message like :
ERROR: Instance d6f3861d-21d2-4e96-9df1-64cf6439ea9c is not currently
available for an action to be performed (task status was (84 ERROR Build
error: guestagent timeout.)). (HTTP 422)

But here we actually need action only.

Change-Id: Iab69ba01937aa8e7a9be9e95e499d64891beed03
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>

Change-Id: Ib5eb12769128527a6f4b3b5f7674bd2dad0ed160

commit_message:
Fix libvirt daemon name condition

This makes the condition that chooses which daemon name libvirt to call
the same as for choosing the livirt package names.

Without this fix the condition checking for a directory is incorrect
when livirt is not yet installed, but is used before installing the
packages.

Change-Id: Ib5eb12769128527a6f4b3b5f7674bd2dad0ed160

[{'number': 27, 'created': '2017-12-19 20:25:36.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts_spec.rb', 'manifests/logging.pp', 'manifests/db/sync.pp', 'manifests/db/sync_api.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_db_online_data_migrations_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/nova-manage-user-16e7145d0c10bf57.yaml', 'manifests/cell_v2/map_cell0.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_cell_v2_map_cell_and_hosts_spec.rb', 'manifests/db/online_data_migrations.pp', 'manifests/cell_v2/discover_hosts.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_cell_v2_map_cell0_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/nova_logging_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/nova_cell_v2_map_instances.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/nova.rb', 'manifests/params.pp', 'manifests/cell_v2/map_cell_and_hosts.pp', 'manifests/cron/archive_deleted_rows.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_db_sync_spec.rb', 'manifests/cell_v2/map_instances.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_cron_archive_deleted_rows_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/nova_db_sync_api_spec.rb'], 'message': "Correct permissions on the nova logfiles

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Similar issues are possible for other nova logs, if for example
a nova services is initially started manually as root, so the
ownership of all nova logs is corrected before configuring nova.

Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>
Closes-Bug: #1671681
Change-Id: I0ca0110cbf9139c79074cf603dcab9135f96e765
"}]
commit_message:
Correct permissions on the nova logfiles

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Similar issues are possible for other nova logs, if for example
a nova services is initially started manually as root, so the
ownership of all nova logs is corrected before configuring nova.

Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>
Closes-Bug: #1671681
Change-Id: I0ca0110cbf9139c79074cf603dcab9135f96e765

subject: Remove display_name and display_description parameters from snapshot API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-19 12:05:12.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_snapshots_negative.py'], 'message': "Remove display_name and display_description parameters from snapshot API

Cinder V1 APIs are deprecated long back. Create/update snapshots were
accepting display_name and display_description parameters in the
request body but in v2/v3 these parameters are replaced by 'name' and
'description'. When this change was introduced, tempest tests were
not modified. Recently, we are adding schema support for v2/v3 APIs
[1] due to which tempest tests are failing as v2/v3 doesn't accept
display_name and display_description parameter in the request body.

This patch fixes failing test cases by passing 'name' parameter
instead of 'display_name' in request body.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520991/

Change-Id: Icf4a5355134b4c7a9f102822c84d9c2404afa476
"}]
commit_message:
Remove display_name and display_description parameters from snapshot API

Cinder V1 APIs are deprecated long back. Create/update snapshots were
accepting display_name and display_description parameters in the
request body but in v2/v3 these parameters are replaced by 'name' and
'description'. When this change was introduced, tempest tests were
not modified. Recently, we are adding schema support for v2/v3 APIs
[1] due to which tempest tests are failing as v2/v3 doesn't accept
display_name and display_description parameter in the request body.

This patch fixes failing test cases by passing 'name' parameter
instead of 'display_name' in request body.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520991/

Change-Id: Icf4a5355134b4c7a9f102822c84d9c2404afa476

commit_message:
Finalize migration to keystoneauth adapters

removes code that allowed some service sections to not have and use
keystoneauth adapter options.

Also deprecates `[keystone]region_name` option in favor of per-client
option of the same name.

Change-Id: Ifd58947b016bfa93b516dd47a170ba8f5abf277e
Closes-Bug: #1699547

commit_message:
Inital import of tripleo ansible inventory code

This is moved from tripleo-validations so we can make use of the
same code in tripleoclient for undercloud deploy, commit copied:

a1e9265 Merge "Fix include action DEPRECATION WARNING (Ansible >2.4)"

Note this doesn't currently move the inventory script, as we'll need
to adjust packaging and that's not strictly needed for the use
of the code in tripleoclient.

Change-Id: I03f609b8ff9f36c95a8382aa1705147d99cb973b

'prometheus/templates/pod-helm-tests.yaml', 'prometheus-alertmanager/templates/serviceaccount.yaml', 'prometheus-kube-state-metrics/templates/serviceaccount.yaml'], 'message': 'RBAC: Consolidate serviceaccounts and restrict rbac

Currently, services have two serviceaccounts: one specified in the
chart that cannot read anything, and one injected via helm-toolkit
that can read everything. This patch set refactors the logic to:

- cleanup the roles and their binding automatically when the helm
  chart is deleted;
- remove the need to separately mount a serviceaccount  with secret;
- better handling of namespaces resource restriction.

Co-Authored-By: portdirect <pete@port.direct>

Change-Id: I47d41e0cad9b5b002f59fc9652bad2cc025538dc
'}]
commit_message:
RBAC: Consolidate serviceaccounts and restrict rbac

Currently, services have two serviceaccounts: one specified in the
chart that cannot read anything, and one injected via helm-toolkit
that can read everything. This patch set refactors the logic to:

- cleanup the roles and their binding automatically when the helm
  chart is deleted;
- remove the need to separately mount a serviceaccount  with secret;
- better handling of namespaces resource restriction.

Co-Authored-By: portdirect <pete@port.direct>

Change-Id: I47d41e0cad9b5b002f59fc9652bad2cc025538dc

commit_message:
Pin setuptools to 30.4.0

This pin prevents openstack.nose-plugin from breaking the
command line openstack client. This commit is exclusive to
the stable/mitaka branch because the problem does not occur
on Newton and later.

Change-Id: I61ee2b05cde6a0a048f5ad9ea336de678227a877
Closes-Bug: #1651292

commit_message:
Explicitly start mysql server on ubuntu

The current code expects that MySql server will be up and running by
default, however, at certein deployments this is not the case.
The current patch will invoke a start on mysql server even if it's already
running

Change-Id: I058a474622cfba989c50f8a7ba2d3a6c82267c02

subject: Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-30 04:36:35.000000000', 'files': ['MANIFEST.in'], 'message': "Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

tacker already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
	 setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	 pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I4181944c6ca639451de1772aa3d1ed449a5f4bc5
"}]
commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

tacker already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
	 setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	 pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I4181944c6ca639451de1772aa3d1ed449a5f4bc5

commit_message:
neutron: Allow new config path for metadata agent

Use the new neutron-metadata-agent config path when setting
up the agent. The new path simplifies the startup because
no configuration files must be given due to the automatic defaults
from oslo.config.

Change-Id: I1fa7a7bbb80d299a7ccd46ac600664a81dd96a82

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I43828f47711118eba8d835222586db4faac93180
(cherry picked from commit 6817f0ac3a834385ee208ccad8a338cd3d0a6216)

subject: Use Apache/mod_proxy as the TLS proxy instead of stud
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7662, 'name': 'Rob Crittenden', 'email': 'rcritten@redhat.com', 'username': 'rcritten'}, {'_account_id': 7979, 'name': 'Mikhail S Medvedev', 'email': 'mihailmed@gmail.com', 'username': 'msmedved'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20084, 'name': 'Intel networking-odl CI', 'email': 'intel-odl-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-odl-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-07-01 17:51:35.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder', 'lib/nova', 'unstack.sh', 'lib/neutron-legacy', 'files/apache-tlsproxy.template', 'files/debs/tls-proxy', 'lib/keystone', 'lib/swift', 'lib/glance', 'lib/tls', 'files/apache-keystone.template', 'lib/apache', 'stack.sh'], 'message': "Use Apache/mod_proxy as the TLS proxy instead of stud

Setting a proxy for a service is now a two-step process:

1. Add a configuration for the listener port using add_tls_proxy
2. Restart Apache using start_tls_proxy

Some services have multiple ports so this reduces the number
of Apache restarts required.

A template is used to generate configuration for each
service and is appended to tlsproxy.conf in the
appropriate Apache config subdir. This is still
readable and makes cleanup simpler.

No SSLCertificateChainFile/SSLCACertificateFile is set
because the devstack CA is added to the system bundle.

The SSL/TLS certificate generated by devstack is now
broken out into separate cert/key files for use by
Apache.

Add enable_mod_proxy function so Apache can act as a TLS proxy.

If the tlsproxy service is enabled then ensure that Apache,
mod_ssl and mod_proxy are all enabled. Don't rely on Keystone
to enable these.

Change-Id: Iafb2fa24b7738779c82171dfc57d43877c2e5ed6
"}]
commit_message:
Use Apache/mod_proxy as the TLS proxy instead of stud

Setting a proxy for a service is now a two-step process:

1. Add a configuration for the listener port using add_tls_proxy
2. Restart Apache using start_tls_proxy

Some services have multiple ports so this reduces the number
of Apache restarts required.

A template is used to generate configuration for each
service and is appended to tlsproxy.conf in the
appropriate Apache config subdir. This is still
readable and makes cleanup simpler.

No SSLCertificateChainFile/SSLCACertificateFile is set
because the devstack CA is added to the system bundle.

The SSL/TLS certificate generated by devstack is now
broken out into separate cert/key files for use by
Apache.

Add enable_mod_proxy function so Apache can act as a TLS proxy.

If the tlsproxy service is enabled then ensure that Apache,
mod_ssl and mod_proxy are all enabled. Don't rely on Keystone
to enable these.

Change-Id: Iafb2fa24b7738779c82171dfc57d43877c2e5ed6

commit_message:
Add 'hitch' support for 'tls-proxy' option.

As 'stud' used by 'tls-proxy' service was deprecated since Ubuntu xenial,
add 'hitch' support as a replacement of 'stud'.
Either of 'stud' or 'hitch' will be automatically selected depending on the distro release.

Change-Id: Ibcedcc0648d341d9d8280d113dd8e6b5ccd0af18
Closes-Bug: 1613071
Signed-off-by: Masanori Itoh <masanori.itoh@gmail.com>

subject: Fix cinder error when rejoin stack after system reboot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-11 02:21:02.000000000', 'files': ['lib/lvm', 'lib/cinder_backends/lvm', 'lib/cinder', 'rejoin-stack.sh'], 'message': 'Fix cinder error when rejoin stack after system reboot

lvm volume is not started automatically after system reboot, so
cinder will complain volumes not found. This patch will try to
restart volumes when rejoining stack.

Change-Id: I488ad5d58d3bd06cb1e2c4ba304bee1f94ea6228
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder error when rejoin stack after system reboot

lvm volume is not started automatically after system reboot, so
cinder will complain volumes not found. This patch will try to
restart volumes when rejoining stack.

Change-Id: I488ad5d58d3bd06cb1e2c4ba304bee1f94ea6228

the nova configuration for the ironic hypervisor to use the "nova"

of the n-api service and the db service, when really
they need not be on the same host.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-19 12:32:28.000000000', 'files': ['inc/python', 'lib/apache'], 'message': 'Changes to get devstack working with python3

* Install libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 in Ubuntu for python3
* If the pip_install function is called for a package instead of
  an OpenStack service, then install it on both python2 and python3.
  --upgrade will be forced in this case because we want the binaries
  of Python3 to take precedence over the ones that are provided by
  Python2.

Depends-On: I25c46f2211af8075974a93acdf587cd059673bbb
Depends-On: Iab9c23e497956e45c5d04a3d6513acf1b026aafb
Depends-On: Ic3eff6609d35a756b8be7adf0557ce17d1465408

Change-Id: I4ca6366d4a4d1b007d12e7cd3975506e101d42c0
'}]
commit_message:
Changes to get devstack working with python3

* Install libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 in Ubuntu for python3
* If the pip_install function is called for a package instead of
  an OpenStack service, then install it on both python2 and python3.
  --upgrade will be forced in this case because we want the binaries
  of Python3 to take precedence over the ones that are provided by
  Python2.

Depends-On: I25c46f2211af8075974a93acdf587cd059673bbb
Depends-On: Iab9c23e497956e45c5d04a3d6513acf1b026aafb
Depends-On: Ic3eff6609d35a756b8be7adf0557ce17d1465408

Change-Id: I4ca6366d4a4d1b007d12e7cd3975506e101d42c0

Add a patching mechanism right after cloning the
projects and fetching plugins, in order to allow the
user to supply patches. User will place his patches
under a "patches" directory under the devstack root

commit_message:
Support patching projects/plugins

Add a patching mechanism right after cloning the
projects and fetching plugins, in order to allow the
user to supply patches. User will place his patches
under a "patches" directory under the devstack root
directory. The patch name will start with the name of
the project/plugin, and end with ".patch", and between
the user can put a string to identify the patch.

Change-Id: Ie28e1f8dda4ea138f08a3a8e3962bdfbe7ec2b06
Closes-Bug: #1606625

commit_message:
WIP/DNM: Leave me alone, I'm concentrating...

Don't merge of course

Inform user that the logfile skips lines matching regex

Provide a notice at the top and bottom of the logfile informing the user
that the logfile does not print content that matches the specified
regular expression. At the bottom provide statistics on how many lines
were skipped based on the regex match.

commit_message:
DNM: Test with python 3.4 enabled

Try and get to a full devstack run with python 3 enabled(ie clients and
projects with the python 3 classifiers use python 3).

Once gate jobs succeed and the corresponding python libraries are fixed and
released, they'll be added as a non-voting job or as experimental jobs to
respective projects.

Change-Id: I3a1dfde76009cbac1d419e0ff3f1d20c4a2e99c3

subject: Fix the way to get backup metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-12-13 09:12:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix the way to get backup metadata

In v3/shell.py do_backup_update(), the metadata through
'args.metadata' is a list, like this: 'metadata': [u'k1=v1'].
But we need a metadata dict like this: 'metadata': {"k1": "v1"}.
So call the right method shell_utils.extract_metadata()
to get metadata from args.

Change-Id: I82cb96b1f89b4009d4b3f4a0e64db076a7a04977
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the way to get backup metadata

In v3/shell.py do_backup_update(), the metadata through
'args.metadata' is a list, like this: 'metadata': [u'k1=v1'].
But we need a metadata dict like this: 'metadata': {"k1": "v1"}.
So call the right method shell_utils.extract_metadata()
to get metadata from args.

Change-Id: I82cb96b1f89b4009d4b3f4a0e64db076a7a04977

commit_message:
Update cinder info when attach volume that attached

If you attach a volume to two instances, you will
see that the state of the volume is always attaching.
The cause of this bug is 8831f3d0. The state of the
volume should not be used to determine whether or not
the cinder is called.

Closes-Bug: #1736874

Change-Id: I98f22f6988b0a449257493bb9f2b4c7250b8b03a

revisions:

Attaching a container to a neutron network failed with KeyError
on retrieving the 'preserve_on_delete' key from the requested
network. This is because the latest code change in kuryr_network.py

Change-Id: I3e3a1dc35227d4f469619bb8eb9215ca49b3343f
Closes-bug: #1737687
"}]
commit_message:
Add preserve_on_delete field in requested_network when attach network

Attaching a container to a neutron network failed with KeyError
on retrieving the 'preserve_on_delete' key from the requested
network. This is because the latest code change in kuryr_network.py
assumes the 'preserve_on_delete' key is presented but this key is
missing.

Change-Id: I3e3a1dc35227d4f469619bb8eb9215ca49b3343f
Closes-bug: #1737687

commit_message:
Replace jsonutils by common json package

This PS is going to following item:

- Remove dependency oslo.serialization which only use at one test-case
  and use build-in python package that is json[1] in the code-base.
- Ignore N521 check in the flake which no longer need to check when we
  change into json.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/json.html

Change-Id: I22cf66d1ea5666a072a06456213a7964c5deced8

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I43828f47711118eba8d835222586db4faac93180
(cherry picked from commit 6817f0ac3a834385ee208ccad8a338cd3d0a6216)

commit_message:
Add accessbot for #openstack-vpnaas

The Neutron VirtualPrivateNetwork-as-a-Service team is diverging a bit
from the rest of the Neutron team.
In order not to clutter the overall #openstack-neutron channel,
and to serve the VPNaaS team as it continues to diverge from Neutron,
we would like the #openstack-vpnaas channel logged.

Change-Id: I344aee655560f98205afe10895a331fc04403864
Depends-on: I8c89a62566fdb332450b07448e96058933852675

commit_message:
Add schema check for OS-TRUST:trust authentication

If the OS-TRUST:trust is not a dict when authenticating,
Keystone will raise 500 error. This patch add the
related schema check to avoid the error.

Change-Id: I575440fa507c5274e0c3bc09f4cfcb9b3d91a28c
Closes-bug: #1733754

subject: Expose a bug when authenticating for a trust-scoped token
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-11-24 01:34:03.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py'], 'message': "Expose a bug when authenticating for a trust-scoped token

The test added here should pass with a 400 Bad Request, but keystone
doesn't validate the OS-TRUST:trust key of the authentication request
is actually a dictionary. As a result, it assumes it is a dictionary
and attempts to use dictionary methods on. This results in a 500
Internal Server Error when it should really be a 400 Bad Request.

A subsequent patch can fix this by enhancing the jsonschema
definition for token authentication.

Change-Id: I9ea118945870f27dd73000b45673d966ea05ca53
Partial-Bug: #1733754
"}]
commit_message:
Expose a bug when authenticating for a trust-scoped token

The test added here should pass with a 400 Bad Request, but keystone
doesn't validate the OS-TRUST:trust key of the authentication request
is actually a dictionary. As a result, it assumes it is a dictionary
and attempts to use dictionary methods on. This results in a 500
Internal Server Error when it should really be a 400 Bad Request.

A subsequent patch can fix this by enhancing the jsonschema
definition for token authentication.

Change-Id: I9ea118945870f27dd73000b45673d966ea05ca53
Partial-Bug: #1733754

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-10 19:38:16.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Improve exception logging with 500 response

Currently when keystone throws a 500 Error, depending on the actual
exception type, it can log the message as an exception or as a warning.

Specifically, if the server throws an exception.UnexpectedError, it
does not log this as an exception; it simply logs it as a warning. This
patch set logs the error as an exception if exception.Error is an
exception.UnexpectedError.

Change-Id: Ia47cc11378ec64d59b7403cb8a284c764148d7a9
Co-Authored-By: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
Closes-Bug: #1717962
'}]
commit_message:
Improve exception logging with 500 response

Currently when keystone throws a 500 Error, depending on the actual
exception type, it can log the message as an exception or as a warning.

Specifically, if the server throws an exception.UnexpectedError, it
does not log this as an exception; it simply logs it as a warning. This
patch set logs the error as an exception if exception.Error is an
exception.UnexpectedError.

Change-Id: Ia47cc11378ec64d59b7403cb8a284c764148d7a9
Co-Authored-By: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
Closes-Bug: #1717962

commit_message:
Switch to use _get_subnet_object() in ipam_backend_mixin module

This patch switches to use _get_subnet_object() instead of
_get_subnet() method in ipam_backend_mixin module to use Subnet
OVO instead of db model class directly.

Change-Id: Ibdc91ba20b560dc42319565b5f4aeadba0dfcb29
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-11-30 17:20:27.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/flows/manager/create_volume.py'], 'message': 'Fixes Bug1683228

create_from_image() function checks for free space in conversion path
(by default /var/lib/cinder/conversion) even if cinder is creating
volume from image snapshot.

If /var/lib/cinder/conversion has less free space than the size of the
image volume is created from, exception will be thrown by
check_available_space() function in image_utils module.

This patch checks if cinder is configured with
allowed_direct_url_schemes = cinder
If so, cinder should not check free space in conversion path because
volume is created from image snapshot.

Change-Id: I13d2e6aefda6b0ab40bba12e485f97f1c08438e8
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Bug1683228

create_from_image() function checks for free space in conversion path
(by default /var/lib/cinder/conversion) even if cinder is creating
volume from image snapshot.

If /var/lib/cinder/conversion has less free space than the size of the
image volume is created from, exception will be thrown by
check_available_space() function in image_utils module.

This patch checks if cinder is configured with
allowed_direct_url_schemes = cinder
If so, cinder should not check free space in conversion path because
volume is created from image snapshot.

Change-Id: I13d2e6aefda6b0ab40bba12e485f97f1c08438e8

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-12-14 01:16:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Update and complete volume attachments during resize

With the new cinder volume attachment flow, during a resize the
source compute will create a new volume attachment for any BDMs
connected to the instance and delete the existing volume attachments
which represents the connection to the source host. The finish_resize
flow on the destination compute will then refresh the connection info
on the BDMs it's working with before passing them to the virt driver.

Since the source compute updated the BDM.attachment_id to point at
the new attachment which is meant for the destination host, the
refresh_connection_info call will get the connection_info for the new
reserved attachment, which is actually empty since it hasn't been
connected to the destination host yet. This results in wiping out the
BDM.connection_info which has the "driver_volume_type" value which is
something the virt driver on the destination compute needs to know
which volume backend driver to use to connect the volume to the
destination host.

This change updates the volume attachments on the destination host
before refreshing the connection_info in the BDMs and before we call
the driver to finish the resize, and then we also complete the
volume attachments once the driver has successfully finished the
resize. This is similar to what would happen via _prep_block_device
during the initial instance create, but since the code paths into the
driver are different we have to handle this explicitly in the compute
manager.

Similarly, we have to perform the same incantation when reverting a
resize and going back to the original source host.

Closes-Bug: #1737599

Change-Id: Ifc80d07d94311534fd9e7824ede9d09223a011c2
'}]
commit_message:
Update and complete volume attachments during resize

With the new cinder volume attachment flow, during a resize the
source compute will create a new volume attachment for any BDMs
connected to the instance and delete the existing volume attachments
which represents the connection to the source host. The finish_resize
flow on the destination compute will then refresh the connection info
on the BDMs it's working with before passing them to the virt driver.

Since the source compute updated the BDM.attachment_id to point at
the new attachment which is meant for the destination host, the
refresh_connection_info call will get the connection_info for the new
reserved attachment, which is actually empty since it hasn't been
connected to the destination host yet. This results in wiping out the
BDM.connection_info which has the "driver_volume_type" value which is
something the virt driver on the destination compute needs to know
which volume backend driver to use to connect the volume to the
destination host.

This change updates the volume attachments on the destination host
before refreshing the connection_info in the BDMs and before we call
the driver to finish the resize, and then we also complete the
volume attachments once the driver has successfully finished the
resize. This is similar to what would happen via _prep_block_device
during the initial instance create, but since the code paths into the
driver are different we have to handle this explicitly in the compute
manager.

Similarly, we have to perform the same incantation when reverting a
resize and going back to the original source host.

Closes-Bug: #1737599

Change-Id: Ifc80d07d94311534fd9e7824ede9d09223a011c2

commit_message:
Remove the objects for describing the extension for v2.1 API

The ControllerExtension, ResourceExtension objects, V21APIExtensionBase
are used for describing the extension. The v2.1 API already moves to the
plain route list, so those objects are useless now.

Partial implementation of blueprint api-extensions-merge-queens
Change-Id: I15b52d217cb287406a965dd2965c47ef2f5dab20

commit_message:
Remove the objects which related to the old v2 API implementation

The old v2 API implementation is removed since Mitaka. There are still
have some old v2 API objects for loading extension, extension API controller,
and describe the API extension in the tree, so clean up them.

Also remove the fake extension Foxinsocks which is used to legacy v2 testing,
but it is useless now.

Partial implement of blueprint api-extensions-merge-queens
Change-Id: I8c814c756c7733669a8880ddc183a1b062cc55e0

commit_message:
Deduplicate instance.create notification samples

This patch refactors the sample files of instance.create notifications.
As these notifications use a different payload class as the most of the
instance notifications a new common payload sample fragment was also
needed.

Change-Id: I7a8e9507ee30d404e075a46e48070a0f94276e33

commit_message:
Improve Neutron driver _get_resource()

* Add support to resource names that contain underscores (e.g. qos_policy)
* Update _get_resources_by_filters to return a list of matches
  by default.
* Add mock constants

Change-Id: Idc193a2ba7df29025b12da8335efebb8d6b4b5af

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-14 10:16:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/test_network_info.py', 'nova/network/model.py'], 'message': "Fix possible TypeError in VIF.fixed_ips

The VIF['network'] field can be initialized to None and therefore
a later call to VIF.fixed_ips() could raise a TypeError. This problem
was visible during AttachInterfacesTestJSON tempest test case when
nova tried to emit instance.interfacae_attach notification.

This patch checks makes sure that if VIF['network'] is None then
VIF.fixed_ips() return an empty list instead of raising a TypeError.

Change-Id: Ib285d874b19be5bc1dbcd1d2af32e461f67e34cb
Closes-Bug: #1737201
"}]
commit_message:
Fix possible TypeError in VIF.fixed_ips

The VIF['network'] field can be initialized to None and therefore
a later call to VIF.fixed_ips() could raise a TypeError. This problem
was visible during AttachInterfacesTestJSON tempest test case when
nova tried to emit instance.interfacae_attach notification.

This patch checks makes sure that if VIF['network'] is None then
VIF.fixed_ips() return an empty list instead of raising a TypeError.

Change-Id: Ib285d874b19be5bc1dbcd1d2af32e461f67e34cb
Closes-Bug: #1737201

With change I2f367b06e683ed7c815dd9e0536a46e5f0a27e6c, nova-compute
now unconditionally requires Placement 1.14 to be available (the
client side code doesn't check to see if 1.14 is available before
trying to use it).

This change updates the nova-status check for the minimum required
version of Placement and also starts the "Queens" section of the
Placement upgrade notes docs.

Change-Id: I37415e384d375bc9b548a0223f787a9236286bb0
'}]
commit_message:
Update nova-status and docs for nova-compute requiring placement 1.14

With change I2f367b06e683ed7c815dd9e0536a46e5f0a27e6c, nova-compute
now unconditionally requires Placement 1.14 to be available (the
client side code doesn't check to see if 1.14 is available before
trying to use it).

This change updates the nova-status check for the minimum required
version of Placement and also starts the "Queens" section of the
Placement upgrade notes docs.

Change-Id: I37415e384d375bc9b548a0223f787a9236286bb0

commit_message:
[placement] Separate API schemas (resource_class)

In compute APIs, they have their schemas in the
independent directory (nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas).
Placement APIs should be like that as well.

This patch separates API schemas to an independent directory
(nova/api/openstack/placement/schemas)
from nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/resource_class.py.

Subsequent patches will move schemas of other handlers.

Change-Id: I61bfc96953d1158d3204d3f578a5255c18af2d6e

commit_message:
Move flushing block devices to privsep.

A similar pattern to the others. Maybe we should write a more fully fledged
wrapper around blockdev at some point, but I think its not required yet.

Change-Id: Ie65d7c90abd0f8448500089fa48e831aef7b7abf

This patch introduces the first code in the privsep directory which
_does_not_ run with escalated premissions. This is a requirement because
the privsep code has a restricted python path when executing. This
pattern will be used for other methods which are only sometimes

blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

commit_message:
Convert ext filesystem resizes to privsep.

This patch introduces the first code in the privsep directory which
_does_not_ run with escalated premissions. This is a requirement because
the privsep code has a restricted python path when executing. This
pattern will be used for other methods which are only sometimes
escalated.

Change-Id: Ie09e40d6476dcabda2d599e96701d419e3e8bdf0
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

revisions:

A recent change introduced a regression that prevents the neutron
agent from starting.

The issue consists in misusing a vswitch extension argument when
validating it (it's a dict, but handled as a string).

This change fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I19c618a51c50eb1a18a93bd946a12075ba8d004e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix vSwitch extension check

A recent change introduced a regression that prevents the neutron
agent from starting.

The issue consists in misusing a vswitch extension argument when
validating it (it's a dict, but handled as a string).

This change fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I19c618a51c50eb1a18a93bd946a12075ba8d004e

subject: Zuulv3: Add some devstack nodesets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-14 22:00:38.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Zuulv3: Add some devstack nodesets

These illustrate a way to set up nodes and groups for devstack jobs
that can scale out to more multinode jobs later.  They can also be
used for other deployment systems (thus the openstack-name).  We
can move these into openstack-zuul-jobs later.

They create a tempest group that includes the controller node, but
creating its own group gives us the possibility to move it to other
nodes later (for instance, a nodeset where tempest did not run on
the controller).

Change-Id: I682ad9a65bd980cb8921b63d16176b88155ce742
'}]
commit_message:
Zuulv3: Add some devstack nodesets

These illustrate a way to set up nodes and groups for devstack jobs
that can scale out to more multinode jobs later.  They can also be
used for other deployment systems (thus the openstack-name).  We
can move these into openstack-zuul-jobs later.

They create a tempest group that includes the controller node, but
creating its own group gives us the possibility to move it to other
nodes later (for instance, a nodeset where tempest did not run on
the controller).

Change-Id: I682ad9a65bd980cb8921b63d16176b88155ce742

commit_message:
doc: add note about fixing admin-only APIs without a microversion

This is a follow up to change I947e927802f755ccb25a91efd82cac895779d19e
to document the decision and agreements made in that change about fixing
obvious regression bugs in admin-only APIs without a microversion.

Change-Id: I4051cb465c509db63620ee727654f7c896fab1e8
Related-Bug: #1733886

commit_message:
Shift tripleo-ci from infra to tripleo

The tripleo-ci repo is an infra repo for historical reasons that don't
make any sense any more.

Recognize that the content in this repo is actually owned and managed by
the TripleO team and not the Infra team.

Change-Id: Ic61941feb817ed8a12cedf330b5aed7b60aa284d

commit_message:
Retire puppet-apps_site

The app catalog was retired earlier this year, see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2017-July/013965.html

Since the site and repos are retired, we can retire the puppet module as
well.

Change-Id: I699aba4426db45f2a62b945a41304564e0724470
Depends-On: I638cc127d3588d757a4da01984a2bd292a84413c

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-12-16 08:37:40.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/haproxy-basic-auth-e2839941c806c615.yaml', 'spec/defines/tripleo_haproxy_endpoint_spec.rb', 'spec/defines/tripleo_haproxy_userlist_spec.rb', 'manifests/haproxy/userlist.pp', 'spec/defines/tripleo_haproxy_service_endpoints_spec.rb', 'manifests/haproxy/endpoint.pp', 'manifests/haproxy/service_endpoints.pp', 'spec/fixtures/hieradata/default.yaml'], 'message': 'Add Basic Authentication support for HAProxy

In order to get a proper support for authenticated endpoints, this patch
creates a new definition (tripleo::haproxy::userlist) and exploit it in

standard tripleo::haproxy::endpoint.

It also detected a small issue with the "underscorization" of the
service name, the missing 'G' flag for regsubst, that preventend all
dashes to be replaced by underscores.

Change-Id: Ie7471155d1ef3f6adc177a468b81ac410bbfb9c0
Closes-Bug: 1736132
'}]
commit_message:
Add Basic Authentication support for HAProxy

In order to get a proper support for authenticated endpoints, this patch
creates a new definition (tripleo::haproxy::userlist) and exploit it in
the dynamic endpoint (tripleo::haproxy::service_endpoints) as well as
standard tripleo::haproxy::endpoint.

It also detected a small issue with the "underscorization" of the
service name, the missing 'G' flag for regsubst, that preventend all
dashes to be replaced by underscores.

Change-Id: Ie7471155d1ef3f6adc177a468b81ac410bbfb9c0
Closes-Bug: 1736132

subject: Allow wsrep_max_ws_rows and wsrep_max_ws_size to use defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-18 17:19:46.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/pacemaker/database/mysql.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/database/mysql_bundle.pp'], 'message': 'Allow wsrep_max_ws_rows and wsrep_max_ws_size to use defaults

Starting with MariaDB 10.1.17 / 10.0.27, the wsrep_max_ws_rows
setting suddenly becomes meaningful, as with previous releases
it had no effect [1].   At the same time, MariaDB has changed
the default value from 131072 to "0" which means no limit,
so that their providing this functionality didn't break anything.
This breaks it for tripleo because we are hardcoding that
never-functional default which makes for much too small writesets.

On the MySQL-Galera side, it's unclear if
the wsrep_max_ws_rows setting yet has a meaningful effect, as [2] [3] remain
open but then in [4] they advertise that it *does* work, but
again they've changed the default to 0/no limit.

Additionally, the size of a writeset is more usefully limited
by the wsrep_max_ws_size variable, which here is also hardcoded
to an obselete default of 1G, the aforementioned MariaDB versions
have also bumped the default to 2G.

I've looked up the origin of these settings in [5] and see
no useful rationale for these numbers to be present, rather than
allowing database-provided defaults to be used.

In all cases it is definite that the wsrep_max_ws_rows setting
of 131072 has never been used by any of the MariaDB/MySQL/Galera
variants and we should not be setting this.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-system-variables/#wsrep_max_ws_rows
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/codership-mysql/+bug/1373909
[3] https://github.com/codership/mysql-wsrep/issues/257
[4] http://galeracluster.com/2016/08/announcing-galera-cluster-5-5-50-and-5-6-31-with-galera-3-17/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177765/

Change-Id: I0d25666fed15347c8351f127d8f564b2037ca065
Closes-bug: #1738777
'}]
commit_message:
Allow wsrep_max_ws_rows and wsrep_max_ws_size to use defaults

Starting with MariaDB 10.1.17 / 10.0.27, the wsrep_max_ws_rows
setting suddenly becomes meaningful, as with previous releases
it had no effect [1].   At the same time, MariaDB has changed
the default value from 131072 to "0" which means no limit,
so that their providing this functionality didn't break anything.
This breaks it for tripleo because we are hardcoding that
never-functional default which makes for much too small writesets.

On the MySQL-Galera side, it's unclear if
the wsrep_max_ws_rows setting yet has a meaningful effect, as [2] [3] remain
open but then in [4] they advertise that it *does* work, but
again they've changed the default to 0/no limit.

Additionally, the size of a writeset is more usefully limited
by the wsrep_max_ws_size variable, which here is also hardcoded
to an obselete default of 1G, the aforementioned MariaDB versions
have also bumped the default to 2G.

I've looked up the origin of these settings in [5] and see
no useful rationale for these numbers to be present, rather than
allowing database-provided defaults to be used.

In all cases it is definite that the wsrep_max_ws_rows setting
of 131072 has never been used by any of the MariaDB/MySQL/Galera
variants and we should not be setting this.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-system-variables/#wsrep_max_ws_rows
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/codership-mysql/+bug/1373909
[3] https://github.com/codership/mysql-wsrep/issues/257
[4] http://galeracluster.com/2016/08/announcing-galera-cluster-5-5-50-and-5-6-31-with-galera-3-17/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177765/

Change-Id: I0d25666fed15347c8351f127d8f564b2037ca065
Closes-bug: #1738777

commit_message:
Add reproducer script for OVB and multinode jobs

This review adds functionality to create a reproducer
script in the logs. The reproducer script will allow
users to recreate failing OVB and multinode jobs
in personal cloud tenants.

User documentation for the reproducer-quickstart script
is added.

Change-Id: I9fe8550a75c3ffb6d1271b01b1144bfbdc82c95d

commit_message:
undercloud: set default_resource_class to 'baremetal'

We already default to this value when enrolling nodes with our workflows, and when
upgrading an undercloud to Pike. This change ensures that nodes enrolled outside
of our workflows also default to 'baremetal'.

A similar change to instack-undercloud is Iee8604a6a942c12e6fa6b9cb8ea88a2cee1ead8f

Change-Id: I8c3c45810571a5d58d8d3c21561b96186d2ebbb2
Partial-Bug: #1732190

commit_message:
schedule gateway on chassis with external connectivity

Currently ovn schedules gateway router ports on all chassis.
Instead we need to check which chassis has external connectivity
and schedule them only on these chassis.

Chassis which has ovn-bridge-mappings properly configured(i.e
physnet same as gateway network physnet) in OVN_Southbound
database will be treated as having external connectivity.
Some network types(for example, geneve) may not use bridge
mappings. Currently, external networks of type VLAN and FLAT
use bridge mappings. So for these networks, we return chassis
with proper bridge mappings and for other networks we return
all chassis.

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py
    networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py
    networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py
    networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_router.py

Closes-bug: #1705246
Change-Id: I73970aef6d84019032e3c68a6a785d7626ae2afc
(cherry picked from commit 14d8e70cfae41fed5e9515dddda714b54a3c67bf)

commit_message:
Remove osd_pool_default_min_size to allow Ceph cluster to do the right thing by default

The default value is 0 which has the minimum number be caluclated based on the replica count
from osd_pool_defaut_size. The default replica count is 3 and the calculated min_size is 2.
If the replica count is 1 then the min_size is 1. ie: min_size = replica - (replica/2)
Add CephPoolDefaultSize parameter to ceph-mon.yaml. This parameter defaults to 3 but can
be overriden. See puppet-ceph-devel.yaml for an example

Change-Id: Ie9bdd9b16bcb9f11107ece614b010e87d3ae98a9
(cherry picked from commit cdfe03566354b938e94c6863b0d4b1c3e64cc10c)

subject: Remove osd_pool_default_min_size to allow Ceph cluster to do the right thing by default

commit_message:
Remove osd_pool_default_min_size to allow Ceph cluster to do the right thing by default

The default value is 0 which has the minimum number be caluclated based on the replica count
from osd_pool_defaut_size. The default replica count is 3 and the calculated min_size is 2.
If the replica count is 1 then the min_size is 1. ie: min_size = replica - (replica/2)
Add CephPoolDefaultSize parameter to ceph-mon.yaml. This parameter defaults to 3 but can
be overriden. See puppet-ceph-devel.yaml for an example

Change-Id: Ie9bdd9b16bcb9f11107ece614b010e87d3ae98a9
(cherry picked from commit cdfe03566354b938e94c6863b0d4b1c3e64cc10c)

subject: Remove certificate before updating it
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-19 01:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/extraconfig/tls/tls-cert-inject.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove certificate before updating it

Containerized HAProxy always tries to load the SSL certificate; if TLS
is not enabled it will create the file as a directory. This messes up
with the script that actually injects the HAProxy certificate into the
undercloud. To address this, we update that script to take this into
account.

Change-Id: Ifc748648cc0f8caaf5a551fd0bc5724b94f3087d
Closes-Bug: #1728267
(cherry picked from commit d1f3b1f683216cf728846c6403994baefe02d5d6)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove certificate before updating it

Containerized HAProxy always tries to load the SSL certificate; if TLS
is not enabled it will create the file as a directory. This messes up
with the script that actually injects the HAProxy certificate into the
undercloud. To address this, we update that script to take this into
account.

Change-Id: Ifc748648cc0f8caaf5a551fd0bc5724b94f3087d
Closes-Bug: #1728267
(cherry picked from commit d1f3b1f683216cf728846c6403994baefe02d5d6)
